In the Senate, I’m pushing to pass my #NotInvisible Act & #SavannasAct to address violent crime against Native women. These bipartisan bills will coordinate gov’t efforts to prevent violent crime & create clear guidelines for handling crimes when they occur.

While I'm working in the Senate to support unions, I also want to make sure they're able to fight for themselves. We need to expand collective bargaining rights so unions can do what they do best: lead the way in the fight for dignity for workers.

I’m also pushing for investments in manufacturing, clean energy, & innovative transportation solutions. Nevada is the #InnovationState, and we’re building the economy of the 21st century because it’s good for both our environment & our state's economy.

1 of my priorities in the Senate is to make sure we keep good paying jobs here in the US. I’m going to oppose trade deals that lack strong union-supported protections for American jobs. We shouldn’t be trying to grow our economy at the expense of our workers.

The census determines how many House representatives each state gets & how voting district boundaries are drawn. Businesses also use census data to determine where to expand operations. There’s too much at stake to let rural communities be undercounted in #Census2020.

The Constitution requires a census each decade to count every person living in America, but too often rural communities are overlooked & undercounted. NV is among the states at greatest risk of an undercount in #Census2020 according to @urbaninstitute https://www.urban.org/research/publication/assessing-miscounts-2020-census …

It’s critical that our rural communities are counted in #Census2020. From representation in government, to federal funding and economic growth, Nevada’s rural communities can’t be overlooked or undercounted. We have terrific challenges in front of us, but we also have solutions that people barely dreamed of a century ago. And Nevada is to me ground zero for these dynamic new possibilities. That’s why it’s the #InnovationState & can lead the way for the rest of the nation.

That could mean encouraging training at community colleges, thru apprenticeships w/labor, or via employer-based opportunities. We can ask people in our factories to be fast in responding to changing times—but we must provide the kind of jobs that let them build successful lives.

As we utilize more green tech, Nevadans can absolutely fill the technical roles needed in this growing industry, like those required to maintain @RTCWashoe’s electric buses. But we have to work together & pioneer innovative ways to get them the training & qualifications they need

And when we’ve got more energy flowing into that renewable pipeline, we need to make sure people can leverage it—that’s why I’ve introduced legislation to build clean energy infrastructure, coordinate a national zero-emission transportation policy, & employ green tech in schools

I’m doing my part in the Senate by working hard to expand the clean energy pipeline by securing tax credits for renewables, from microturbines to fiber-optic solar to fuel cells. And I’m pushing to reduce barriers to investment in renewable energy in NV & across America

I’m proud of the work NV is doing to bring clean energy tech, like @RTCWashoe’s new electric buses, to people across the state. And thanks to our legislature& @GovSisolak, NV is committed to relying on renewables for half of our energy by 2030 & to going fully carbon free by 2050

Let's pass the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019, which has already been passed by the House. And let's pass legislation to fund gun violence research at @CDCgov.
 
Enough is enough. @senatemajldr and @SenateGOP, work with me to finally end this epidemic.

And let's get something done in honor of loved ones who are still with us. So that our mothers, fathers, daughters, sons, sisters, brothers, and friends can go to Walmart on a Saturday morning or spend an evening out with friends without fearing they'll be next.

.@SenateGOP, @senatemajldr, work with me. Let's offer the American people solutions to this violence, not just our thoughts and prayers. Let’s get something done in honor of those we have lost, from El Paso to Dayton to Las Vegas to Parkland and more.

This weekend, 31 lives were taken from their loved ones in senseless acts of violence. More are in critical condition due to injuries from these attacks. For too long, gun violence has been met with inaction⁠—or indifference⁠—by @SenateGOP.
 
That must end. #EnoughIsEnough

My heart aches for Dayton. In less than a day, Americans have learned of two mass shootings and 29 lives taken by hate. In less than a week we’ve had three communities forever scarred by mass shootings. It doesn’t have to be this way.

Monitoring the situation in El Paso. My heart goes out to the victims of this senseless attack and their loved ones. We cannot sit by as more Americans’ lives are put at risk due to gun violence—we need to act in Congress to stop it.
